page.title: 10HUISH WOODS, HATCH BEAUCHAMP
page.content: Huish Woods was given to the Scouts, Guides, Brownies and Cubs by a local landowner. Skip Govet, founded the site and each Scout and Cub, Guide and Brownie pack from the surrounding area has a camping site there. It is situated near Bath House Farm by the A358. Groups usually only camp for the weekend. The main parts of the woods are the "Monkey Parlour",the "Chapel" and "Gore_Langton Hall" which commemorates the person who donated the site to the Scouts. There is also a car park. The "Monkey Parlour" is a big play area with ropes and tree trunks made into play equipment. The "Chapel" is outdoors and has an altar with a cross on it. "Gore_Langton Hall",situated at the end of a long track,is a hall used for wet weather activities.
